stimulus:
In this study, you will read text scenarios and make slider judgments about the situations which they describe. Here is an image of an example trial.


In the upcoming trials, please read the descriptions and give your answer by clicking on the slider. Please read each scenario description carefully, but we are interested in your intuitive judgment so no need to second-guess yourself.

You must make a slider judgment in each trial. You will not receive any feedback.


When you are ready to begin, press the start button.

After a trip to an art museum, Emily talks about her favorite exhibits with David.
Emily: "The contemporary art section was fascinating! I could spend hours there!"
David: "I actually thought it was a bit boring. I didn't really understand the art."

How boring were the exhibits for David?

Chris's friend Emma asks Chris if he wants to join her on a weekend trip.
Emma: "We're planning a spontaneous road trip this weekend. Want to join?"
Chris: "That sounds awesome, but I'm exhausted from traveling all week. I think I need some downtime instead."

How tired is Chris?

Sarah excitedly talks about a recent indie band concert she attended with her friend Mark.
Sarah: "I'm so happy I was able to hear them live. I loved every moment!"
Mark: "I thought it was kind of boring. I struggled getting into the music."

How boring was the concert for Mark?

Jo's manager shares their thoughts on a recent company webinar.
Manager: "The webinar on productivity strategies was so enlightening."
Jo: "I thought it was slightly boring. The content didn't really resonate with me."

How boring was the webinar for Jo?

During a coffee break, Mike notices their colleague looking overwhelmed.
Mike: "You seem really swamped with work lately. I'm kind of concerned that you might be taking on too much."

How concerned is Mike?

Jo's manager shares their thoughts on a recent company webinar.
Manager: "The webinar on productivity strategies was so enlightening."
Jo: "I thought it was boring. The content didn't really resonate with me."

How boring was the webinar for Jo?

Ben's cousin Amy asks him if he's coming to their monthly family gathering.
Amy: "Are you coming to the family dinner this evening?"
Ben: "I'd love to, but I'm quite exhausted from work this week. I'll catch up with everyone next time."

How tired is Ben?

Chris's friend Emma asks Chris if he wants to join her on a weekend trip.
Emma: "We're planning a spontaneous road trip this weekend. Want to join?"
Chris: "That sounds awesome, but I'm a bit exhausted from traveling all week. I think I need some downtime instead."

How tired is Chris?

John invites his friend Alex to a weekend camping trip, but Alex declines.
Alex: "I'd love to go, but I think I need some rest this weekend."
John: "That's kind of understandable. You've been taking on a lot recently. I can ask you later in the year when you have more time."

How understandable does John think Alex's reasons are?

Alex is attending a lecture, but a group of students nearby is talking loudly, making it hard to hear the professor.
Alex (to the students): "It's a bit difficult to listen to the lecture with all the talking. Could you keep it down please?"

How difficult is it for Alex to listen to the lecture?

Amy's boyfriend Jake wants to talk her about their date this weekend, but Amy is tired.
Jake: "Hey Amy, can we talk about this weekend?"
Amy: "I'm exhausted right now. Would it be okay if we talk about it tomorrow instead?"

How tired is Amy?

Sarah is interning at a company, and her boss, Mr. Thompson asks her if she can stay to finish up her report.
Mr. Thompson: "Could you stay late today to help finish up the report?"
Sarah: "I'm feeling slightly exhausted after the back-to-back meetings today, so I'm not sure I'd be at my best. Would it be alright if come in early tomorrow instead to finish it up?"

How tired is Sarah?

Melissa's colleague shares their positive experience at a networking event.
Colleague: "I enjoyed the event and made some great connections."
Melissa: "Honestly, I found the event boring. I struggled to find conversations that interested me."

How boring was the networking event for Melissa?

John invites his friend Alex to a weekend camping trip, but Alex declines.
Alex: "I'd love to go, but I think I need some rest this weekend."
John: "That's understandable. You've been taking on a lot recently. I can ask you later in the year when you have more time."

How understandable does John think Alex's reasons are?

Jane reads a fantasy novel, a genre she doesn't usually enjoy, because a friend recommended it.
Friend: "So, what did you think?"
Jane: "It was kind of good. The world-building was more interesting than I expected."

How good did Jane think the novel was?
